quest.name: City of the Ancients
objectives: Inspect the Ondo Cups from the survey point.
Use the mythril knife to collect scrapings from the remnant wall.
Find a structure which resembles those in the copy of the Qitana Ravel mural, then inspect it from the survey point.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Ah, Forename. Have you learned aught of note?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Fascinating...and precisely the sort of information I was hoping to hear.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In fact, if you have a moment, I'd like to borrow your eyes to confirm a theory I've been working on. Come.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now, there are two tasks I would have you perform.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The first requires you to inspect the buildings which surround the Ondo settlement, and note their most distinctive characteristics.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: For the second, I wish you to use this knife to take scrapings from one of the remnant walls.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Pray be as thorough as you can. I shall be waiting here for the results of your investigations.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: 'Tis strange to be here, under the ocean. It seems a lifetime ago that we stood amidst the trees of Rak'tika...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Inspect the structures of the Ondo Cups for distinctive features. You may move the camera, as well as zoom in and out. Target a building and examine it with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You set the point of the knife against the wall, but even after applying considerable pressure, you cannot remove so much as a flake of stone.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And what have you discovered?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Yes, I would agree that the windows are most distinctive. 'Twould seem the structures appear the same to both your sight and mine...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And you say you could not so much as scratch the wall? Even with all your might behind the blade?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Forename, everywhere I turn in this place, my gaze is drawn by peculiar materials for which I do not have a name.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The buildings I had you investigate are prime examples. They may appear to be constructed of ordinary stone, but I assure you it is nothing of the sort...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If pressed, I would describe the substance as a composite of several mineral properties, blended to create a material of unparalleled durability.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Even the Ronkan Empire, once the greatest power in Norvrandt, produced nothing which compares to this level of perfection.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But if not the Ronkans, then who? Who were these ancients the Ondo claim as the architects of their sanctuary?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I suspect our answer lies with the reason Emet-Selch withdrew here to the Tempest.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: He may simply have wished to retreat somewhere mere mortals would struggle to reach...but there are many such remote locations. Why here, specifically?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch is devoted to his role, and thus we might assume his choice of stronghold somehow serves the Ascian agenda.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Or mayhap...'tis a place more dear to him than any other.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Are you saying this was built by ancient Ascians...?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Could this place provide power to Emet-Selch?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I couldn't say either way...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That is my theory, that these structures are remnants of a time before history─of a star that was yet whole and unbroken.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That was my first thought as well. Yet no matter how superior the materials, a ruin is just a ruin. 'Tis naught that would decide a battle's outcome.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Which brings us to my second theory: that he has some other, more personal connection to this site. What if these structures are remnants of a time before history─of a star that was yet whole and unbroken?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It is my theory that these structures are remnants of a time before history─of a star that was yet whole and unbroken.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Such traces in the Source would have been obliterated by the succession of Umbral Calamities, but here in the First they might have remained untouched for millennia...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...A copy of the mural in the Qitana Ravel. Almet presented it to me during my visit to Fanow, after our victory in Kholusia.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
Here, in the first scene...
By Emet-Selch's own words, it depicts a city of eons past and the disaster which befell it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The design is much simplified, of course, but do you see the similarities between its towers and those you have just inspected?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We are close to the truth, I feel. Let us search the surrounds for another tower─one which matches the picture near enough to remove all doubt.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: From what I have seen, naught more than sand and more sand lies to the east, and the south held no such structures. I suggest we try our luck further to the northwest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may view the Qitana Ravel mural at any time during this quest by using the relevant item in the Key Items menu.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The quest destination will not be displayed on the map. You must search for a structure which resembles the buildings in the mural, then inspect it from the survey point. The survey point will be found nearby, in a location which allows a full view of the structure.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search for a structure which resembles one of the buildings in this mural, then inspect it from the survey point. The survey point will be found nearby, in a location which allows a full view of the structure.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: According to Y'shtola's investigations, the area further northwest of the Ondo Cups may be a good place to start.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Aye... This is the mural writ large...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though I cannot guess at its purpose, it must have been an imposing sight. How much of the tower's height lies hidden beneath the ground, I wonder...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Centuries of our history have settled upon such ruins. Countless layers of dust and sediment...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...An entire civilization, its existence forgotten by all except a handful of Ascians.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And yet it did exist. They lived here, in this city...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But let us focus on what we've learned thus far. The Ondo chieftain spoke of mysteries stirring─of a land illuminated.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Judging by his words, he believes this phenomenon related to the ancients' return.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thus can we surmise that what the Ondo saw shining in the abyss was, in all likelihood, yet another remnant of this age-old civilization.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And who else would “light the lanterns” as Ryne put it, than Emet-Selch himself? 'Tis almost certain he is there!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But if we are to find this stronghold in a timely manner, it seems gaining the Ondo's trust remains our swiftest path forward.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I only hope our deeds are enough to win them over...
